trial_identification.studytitle: Dyslipidaemia, Oxidative Stress And Arterial Wall Function In Non-Insulin Dependent Diabetes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Double-Blind Randomised Placebo-Controlled Trial Of The Effects Of Fenofibrate And Coenzyme Q10 On Arterial Function In Type 2 Diabetic Subjects With Dyslipidaemia

interventions.interventions: 1.Fenofibrate 200mg/day orally 2.Coenzyme Q10 200mg/day orally 3.Fenofibrate 200mg/day plus Coezyme Q10 200mg/day orally 4.Placebo All for 12 weeks

primaryOutcome.outcome: Acetylcholine-stimulated forearm blood flow measured by strain gauge plethysmography
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline (week 0) and at week 12 after treatment randomisation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Hyperaemic response in forearm blood flow following venous occlusion measured by strain gauge plethysmography
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline (week 0) and at weeks 6 and 12 after treatment randomisation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Hyperaemic flow-mediated dilatation of the brachial artery following arterial occlusion measured by ultrasonography
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline (week 0) and at weeks 6 and 12 after treatment randomisation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Type 2 diabetes
Dyslipidaemia (fasting serum triglycaeride >1.8mmol/L or HDL-cholesterol <1.0mmol/L, with total cholesterol <6.5mmol/L and total cholesterol-to-HDL-cholesterol ratio >4)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Use of antioxidant or lipid-regulating therapy, insulin, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, calcium antagonists or aspirin
Body mass index >40kg/m2
Uncontrolled hypertension (>160/90mmHg)
Serum creatinine >150umol/L

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: University of Western Australia School of Medicine and Pharmacology Royal Perth Hospital Unit GPO Box X2213 Perth WA 6847

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medical Research Council

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To assess whether the combination of fenofibrate and coenzyme Q improves vascualr health in diabetes
